meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Heather Melançon Kathy Riley Jenny Thorngate Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7109.

td.p: Heather Melançon, a program analyst originally from Elk Grove, Illinois
Kathy Riley, a retired college professor from Winter Haven, Florida
Jenny Thorngate, a chemist from Madison, Wisconsin (whose 1-day cash winnings total $22,001)

tr.td: THE LIFE OF A NOVELIST
THE 114th CONGRESS
WELCOME TO BOOZETOWN!
1990s SITCOM SUMMARIES
"V" IS FOR...
VICTORY

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'This Mississippian kept taking screenwriting work even after winning the 1949 Nobel Prize')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: This Mississippian kept taking screenwriting work even after winning the 1949 Nobel Prize

Kathy
Triple Stumper
')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_2_2', 'clue_DJ_2_2_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a sculpture on the monitor.) "Nydia, the Blind Girl of" this city by Randolph Rogers shows Nydia moving through its ash-lined streets; the broken Corinthian capital at her foot represents the city\'s fall')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_3_2', 'clue_DJ_3_2_stuck', '(Heather: What is the [*]?)
(Alex: And the other one?)
(Heather: Uh, what is the--um, the--)
[Beep]
(Alex: No.)
(Heather: Y-[**].)
(Alex: No. You were right, but you got it in way too late. [*] and [**]--we needed both, Heather. Sorry.)

the Yellow River & the Yellow Sea

Heather
Triple Stumper
')

$7,201
krypton')

3 W
(including 2 DDs)

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
